title.narrative: Strengthen Grupos Gestores & promote local development
Stärkande av Grupos Gestores & främjande av lokal utveckling

description.narrative: Insatsen ämnar stärka nätverket Red Nacional de Grupos Gestores (RNGG) och delar av de lokala Groups Gestores (GG). GG är lokala organisationer som består av volontärer som arbetar för lokala ekonomisk och social utveckling i deras samhällen. Genom att stärka utvalda GG och RNGG, är tanken att de på ett bättre sätt skall kunna genomföra sina projekt och aktiviteter. Inom projektet skall RNGG implementera deras strategi för jämställdhet dels inom nätverket och dess verksamhet samt i de utvalda GG. Utöver dessa aktiviteter skall RNGG etablera fyra forum för att öka konkurrenskraften i regionerna i Guatemala, så kallade rundabord för konkurrenskraft. Dessa forum samlar aktörer från offentliga sektorn, privata sektorn, akademiska världen och civilsamhället för att arbeta fram planer för den ekonomiska utvecklingen i den region eller departement som forumet täcker.

The project is considered relevant in relation to the expected results in the Swedish strategy for development cooperation with Guatemala, September 2008 – December 2012, prolonged until 2014. It aims to promote local economic development in rural areas by strengthening the work of local volunteer groups, Grupos Gestores, and their national network Red Nacional de Grupos Gestores (RNGG). Furthermore it aims to promote mainstreaming of gender equality in their work as well as create and promote the coordination between public, private and civil society actors at local and territorial level through the creation and strengthening of round tables on competitiveness.
The Embassy supported RNGG for a six-month initiative (September 2013 until February 2014) for the organisation of a workshop on the Role of Economic Actors in Conflict Prevention and Peace Building as well as support to the organisational consolidation of RNGG and the elaboration of strategies for gender equality and environment into their operations.
The Embassy considers it of interest to give a second support to RNGG given the organisations role in rural development at local as well as regional level. The organisation gathers volunteers to work for local development in their municipalities, helping to create interest and dialogue on issues of development. Given its local bases and nationwide presence, RNGG combines the local initiatives with a larger debate amongst actors from various sectors at local and regional level. The organisation started in 1966 and there are now 102 local volunteer groups.

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The initiative aims to strenghten the impact of the work by the local Grupos Gestores and their network, Red Nacional de Grupos Gestores, and integrate gender equality as an aim within the network and in their work.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
